abstract: Prosecutors say an expert network firm paid more than $400,000 to techology company employees who provided confidential information.
snippet: Prosecutors say an expert network firm paid more than $400,000 to techology company employees who provided confidential information.
lead_paragraph: 8:45 p.m. | Updated Federal authorities on Thursday arrested three employees of some of the world’s largest technology companies on charges that they leaked confidential corporate information. The charges are the latest brought by the government in its rapidly expanding investigation into insider trading on Wall Street. A fourth employee pleaded guilty and is cooperating with investigators.

headline.main: 5 Accused as Insider Trading Inquiry Broadens

byline.original: By Azam Ahmed and Peter Lattman
